intro: Gardenia candida, commonly known as the white gardenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and large, waxy white flowers that emit a sweet fragrance. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking appearance. Gardenia candida prefers warm, humid climates and well-drained soil to thrive. Its flowers are also used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
